intro: Bikkia forsteriana, commonly known as the yellow bikkia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its delicate, yellow flowers with purple veins. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodland floors and stream banks. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Bikkia forsteriana is a short-lived perennial that blooms from late spring to early summer.
